edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.math.cs56_math_conversion_quiz

Class Quiz

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.math.cs56_math_conversion_quiz.Quiz

  • public class Quiz
extends java.lang.Object
    A command line interface for a binary/octal/hex conversion Quiz. Original program by Erick Valle & George Barrios for Mantis 0000391
    Version:
    CS56, Spring 2012, Mantis 0000611, CS56, Fall 2016
    Author:
    Andrew Berls

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Quiz(int numQuestions)
      Constructor intializes a quiz for a fixed number of random questions
      Quiz(int numQuestions, int type)
      Constructor initializes a fixed number of random questions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMode() 
      int getNumQuestions() 
      int getPercentage()
      Get the user's percentage of correct answers
      Question getQuestion(int idx)
      Retrieve a particular question from the questions ArrayList
      java.lang.String getReadout()
      A readout showing the score percentage, e.g., "Your score was 67%!"
      void insertScore(boolean correct)
      Insert a score into the list of user answers
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      main prompts the user for a number of questions and runs a new Quiz
      int numCorrect()
      Get the number of correct answers from the scores array True indicates correct, false for incorrect
      void run()
      Run the Quiz game on the command line For each question, display its prompt and track the user's answer At the end, display the percentage of correct answers.
      void setMode(int mode)
      Set the mode to a specific radix, e.g., 2, 8, 10, 16, 18 in order to practice conversions to that radix

      • getMode

        public int getMode()
        Returns:
        The mode/type of questions in the quiz

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Set the mode to a specific radix, e.g., 2, 8, 10, 16, 18 in order to practice conversions to that radix
        Parameters:
        mode - The type of questions to be asked

      • getNumQuestions

        public int getNumQuestions()
        Returns:
        the number of questions in the quiz

        Returns:

        public void insertScore(boolean correct)
        Insert a score into the list of user answers
        Parameters:
        correct - A boolean indicating if the answer is correct

      • numCorrect

        public int numCorrect()
        Get the number of correct answers from the scores array True indicates correct, false for incorrect
        Returns:
        The number of correct answers

      • getPercentage

        public int getPercentage()
        Get the user's percentage of correct answers
        Returns:
        The percentage of correct answers as an integer

      • getReadout

        public java.lang.String getReadout()
        A readout showing the score percentage, e.g., "Your score was 67%!"
        Returns:
        A string readout

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the Quiz game on the command line For each question, display its prompt and track the user's answer At the end, display the percentage of correct answers.

        main prompts the user for a number of questions and runs a new Quiz
